faq.question: Can ChatGPT summarize PDFs as well as SummarizePDF?
faq.answer: ChatGPT can summarize text you paste from PDFs, but it loses formatting, requires manual processing for each document, and doesn't extract citations. SummarizePDF is purpose-built for PDFs with native parsing, batch processing, and citation extraction.

faq.question: Is SummarizePDF better than ChatGPT for academic research?
faq.answer: Yes, for PDF-based research. SummarizePDF maintains document structure, extracts citations automatically, and can analyze multiple papers simultaneously. ChatGPT requires manual work for each document.

faq.question: Can I use both ChatGPT and SummarizePDF together?
faq.answer: Absolutely! Many users use SummarizePDF for initial PDF summarization and citation extraction, then use ChatGPT for general research questions and writing assistance.

faq.question: Which is more cost-effective for heavy PDF users?
faq.answer: SummarizePDF is more cost-effective for PDF-heavy workflows. ChatGPT Plus is $20/mo but requires manual work and may need API access for automation. SummarizePDF starts at $9/mo with unlimited PDFs and built-in automation.
